chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek T. Rose was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek T. Rose is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derek T. Rose was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Derek T. Rose was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 2:59 PM Defendant Derek T. Rose in court.  Attorney Jessa K. Nicholson in court for Derek T. Rose.  Attorney Curtis E. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.   State recites joint recommendation:  Ct 3: dismissed.  Ct 2: amend to Misd Poss THC.  Cts 1 & 2:  W/H 12 mo probation, each count:  AODA and follow through recommendations; counseling as recommended by DOC.  Costs on Ct 2.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation. Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
Status conference on October 5, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Booking;   No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license;   No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription. Adjourned initial appearance on February 3, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Court grants petition and appoints Atty J. Nicholson as counsel.  $1000 signature bond -   No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license;   No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant and/or Atty Nicholson may appear via zoom for next hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 09:45 am.
